content: frankie s knitted stuff trigger mittens patterns for trigger mittens with a separate forefinger can be found in wartime knitting books originally intended for wearing while shooting i find they re also useful if you use a walking stick with a flat handle these are held with the forefinger in front of the stick and the other three behind and that finger can get very cold sizing your mittens i knitted my mittens with king cole merino blend dk 104 m / 50g shade 1527 which is a thick dk weight yarn i worked to a gauge of 12 stitches and 17 rounds to 5 cm / 2 ² knitting in the round with 4 mm / us size 6 needles my mittens took about 70g of yarn the pattern can be adjusted to fit your hand the knitting will stretch width ways so it is really the lengths that you might need to alter either measure the hand the mitten is for or a pair of gloves that fit you will need the length of the thumb forefinger and the longest finger as well as the measurement between the start of the thumb and the start of the forefinger if you are knitting the mittens for yourself it is also possible to try the mitten on as you go and thus do away with all that measuring i ll explain this along the way … total length 24 cm / 9½ finger length 7 cm / 2¾ hand from thumb to thumb length 6 cm / 2¼ finger 4 cm / 1½ cuff 6 5 cm /2½ these are the measurements for my mittens they are about 22 cm / 8½ around the hand measuring above the thumb right hand the mittens are worked in the round using whichever method you prefer i used one long circular needle and the magic loop method using the long tail method and 3 5 mm / us size 4 needles cast on 40 stitches work 20 rounds in k2 p2 rib or until your cuff is long enough shaping for the thumb rounds 1 & 2 knit change to 4 mm needles for the rest of the mitten round 3 k1 m1 k1 m1 k to end 42 sts rounds 4 & 5 knit round 6 k1 m1 k3 m1 k to end 44 sts rounds 7 & 8 knit round 9 k1 m1 k5 m1 k to end 46 sts rounds 10 & 11 knit round 12 k1 m1 k7 m1 k to end 48 sts rounds 13 & 14 knit round 15 k1 m1 k9 m1 k to end 50 sts rounds 16 & 17 knit round 18 k1 m1 k11 m1 k to end 52 sts rounds 19 & 20 knit the thumb knit 14 stitches these are the thumb stitches transfer the rest of the stitches to a spare needle using the backward loop method cast on four more stitches knit 14 then the four new stitches again
